info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:18PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN HUNTINGDON... NORTHEASTERN MIFFLIN AND SOUTH CENTRAL CENTRE COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 316 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near State College, moving southeast at 25 mph. Other strong storms were to the north and west of State College. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... State College, Lewistown, Bellefonte, Park Forest Village, Boalsburg, Pleasant Gap, Lemont, Burnham, Zion, Houserville, Milroy, Highland Park, Centre Hall, Milesburg, Yeagertown, Reedsville, Juniata Terrace, Spring Mills, Madisonburg and Julian. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central Pennsylvania.
